intro: Mentzelia fragilis, commonly known as the brittlestem bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and may be covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Mentzelia fragilis is an annual or biennial plant that blooms from spring to early summer.
